page.title: 11Farming in West Farnham
page.content: The information that follows was gained by sending a survey to all the farms in our D-square.There were 14 farms of which 7 replied. {Farms Today:}Farms in our area are mainly dairy but some are beef,sheep and arable farms. From our replies we learnt that one farm is now a recording studio,and that two farms blended together. Another is now a private house.All the other farms are still in use. {Types of Soil:}The main types of soil are clay,sand,flint and malm.The area around the river Wey is river silt. This makes the land very fertile. {Size of Farms:}The biggest farm is Cheek's Farm at 630 acres in size, the smallest farm is Holtwood Farm at 22 acres. The main types of boundaries are fences and hedges.
